p: What are the effects of these economic changes on zoonotic risk? At each transitional stage in the value chain, from farm to final market, attempts to increase or maintain profit margins may create opportunities for risks to develop ( Mcleod et al. 2009). As new large retail units seek to capture market shares, they must offer competitive prices by cutting costs. Pressure to survive in a highly competitive market with minimal government support and lack of adequate regulatory oversight may encourage retailers and producers to engage in risky practices, including disinvestment in animal health and biosecurity.
